website_summaries.verdict: A solid contender in camping chairs that is lightweight, portable, and good quality for the price.
pros: The portable style and lightweight design are aspects users appreciate in this chair
Many feel it is also solid and sturdy for outdoor use
cons: A few say it is difficult to put together, and some feel that the balance and comfort needed improvement

website_summaries.verdict: This masterfully crafted backpacking chair is sure to impress both now and in the future.
pros: Includes a breathable seat that is both comfortable and supportive
Foldable mesh construction ensures you can set up the chair in just seconds
and has a weight capacity of 242 lbs
Aluminum alloy frame guarantees the chair is built to last
cons: Seat poles may bend or crack, even after minimal use

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chairs!!!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our chairs!!! We have had them for over a year now and we use them all of the time. We have used them at soccer games, lacrosse games, at the river and beach, backpacking and most recently, a 2 week camping trip. They are very light, quick & easy to assemble and comfortable to sit in. LOVE our Moon Lence chairs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - very weak stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Tried the knockoff Helinox chair. Just don't do it. Quick setup, good size; but upon first sit, the top right tab in the cloth ripped completely out. I only weigh 145 pounds and sat down as I would any other camp chair (read: gently). Just spend the extra money for the higher quality Helinox. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: marcopastor

customer_reviews.title: Broke at first use
customer_reviews.text: Sat in my chair 15 min and it broke after first use.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Dover

customer_reviews.title: We’ve bought cheaper chairs in a similar style since and they’ve been fine.
customer_reviews.text: The metal is one of the legs failed when my 10 year old son sat in it and bent so that the leg would not sit straight and the chair was unusable. I contacted the company who said send us a picture and we’ll replace it. We never did receive the replacement, however, even though I followed up twice about it. We’ve bought cheaper chairs in a similar style since and they’ve been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis  O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: One pole bent after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The seat is not too comfortable for a grown adult male. The top corners stab you in the back. Then after the second time I'm using it one of the seat poles bent. Overall, wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: durable, lightweight, great camping chair at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Kind of tough to figure out how to put together the first time, but once you get it the first time it becomes easy. I took this backpacking in RMNP, and it held up great. Very comfy and stable. I'm a petite woman, so it had no problem holding me. I'm glad I didn't splurge on a more expensive REI one, since this seems to do the job. Edit: since the first review, I've used it several other times and it has held up great. Added a pic from Voyageur's National Park!
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Chair Legs bend easily
customer_reviews.text: The chair leg already bent. I weigh about 220lb and the back left leg already bent.
customer_reviews.author: Max Sarver

customer_reviews.title: I will say that I looked at chairs just like these at REI and Cabellas that honestly seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this a few days so the one thing I can't speak about is how well it will last over time. I will say that I looked at chairs just like these at REI and Cabellas that honestly seem to me to be the same items, just with different branding, oh and about 2 1/2 times the price. I combined this with purchasing a cloth top tripod seat (no back on those) which I found made a perfect foot rest to use in conjunction with this. Save yourself the money and buy this instead of overpaying elsewhere. It's light and very compact!
customer_reviews.author: D. Langhorne

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but keep an eye on the seams.
customer_reviews.text: Handled 3/4 days of Telluride before requiring field repair. Insufficient seam allowance caused fabric to fray and pull out of the upper corner seam. Should not have happened with a 6' 160lb user. My field-repair with a lighter to stop progression of the frayed edge and a sewing kit has held well enough, but I wish I'd caught it earlier. I suppose for ~$35 I can't complain too much -- joints are properly made of fiberglass-reinforced plastic and the aluminum alloy poles have proven solid.
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: It was great and fit into my Ruck Sack Sustainment pouch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to the field. It was great and fit into my Ruck Sack Sustainment pouch. Win win. But now with 25 days left the cloth has started to fray at the corners. I'm just wondering how much longer I have before it rips all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Good chair.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a chair for my wife when we go on portable type trips. I have a similar (much more expensive) chair that I carry in my pannier bags during bike touring but my wife didn't want to spend as much on her chair. This is sturdy and sits well. Small enough to carry just about anywhere. Carry bag has a handle that we clip a carabiner on and click it to wherever it needs to go (including a belt loop) for the approach from the car to wherever. Nice quality material and the legs are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DIYDADDY

customer_reviews.title: We have an unexpected winner here .. This guy is solid bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: So, I needed a chair which is ultralight and comfortable at the same time. I was torn between this one and helinox chair zero. But the price factor encouraged me to try this one. On receiving, I was pleasantly surprised. The reviews are indeed true as this is indeed a mighty ultraportable beast. Fits so easily in the backpack, easy to set up, and yet so useful and comfortable. Then mesh back did wonders in making your butt not soak up after two hours in sweat on continuous usage. Overall its a thumbs up from me
customer_reviews.author: Midhun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact and lightweight chair for beaches/parks/backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lightweight travel/backpacking chair. Packs up extremely small and weights ~2lbs per chair. We use these frequently at the park or beach and can easily tie these to the rear rack of our bikes without adding much weight. It’s not the most comfortable travel chair but it’s certainly comfortable enough, particular given how compact it is. I’ve seen a few versions of this from different brands and honestly can’t tell the difference (prob from the same manufacturer). One nice trick for use on the beach as a lounger is to release the front two legs and dig the back legs into the sand. Turns it into a great backrest while lying on the beach!
customer_reviews.author: VY

customer_reviews.title: Horrible knock off
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure that some people received their chairs in perfect order, but when I tried to assemble mine, the pieces simply would not fit because they were too tight. I even had my boyfriend and his friend attempt to do it and neither were able to slip the final corner over the last pole. I was really hoping this would work, but sometimes you get a defected product and the likelyhood of it happening increases with knockoffs like these.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Life

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Does not come close to the 242 lb max limit. Had a friend who weighs just north of 200 sit in it immediately bent a back rest post. For the price it's hard to pass up, but still expected it to live up to it's description.
customer_reviews.author: STIXY9

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair for being lightweight and small size
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair for being lightweight and small size. Great for backpacking and for the campfire. Found that it sinks easily in soft ground, but found a fix for it. For less than $10 at the hardware store created better legs for the product. The greater surface area allows for better support and won't sink into soft ground as easily. Also these legs can fit in the stuff sack when broken down. Overall love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Emily M. Dorton

customer_reviews.title: Nifty chair BUT...
customer_reviews.text: What a great chair! The poles went together great no need for instrux. HOWEVER to put the seat cover on OMG! I did not have the strength to do it. Tried a couple of ways and alas this 62-year-old somewhat fit woman cannot attach the seat. Just have to stretch it beyond my strength ability to slip it over the slots. So disappointed. Also returned an easy-peasy Crazy Creek seat because it was so uncomfortable. Now I got nuttin' for this weekend bird trip!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia V.

customer_reviews.title: It works/or not
customer_reviews.text: Update: Not a good product. Claimed weight limit is well over 200 lbs. It broke and the only person who has sat in this chair weighs 125. GARBAGE and that’s where it went. Good product. Only four stars because it’s a blatant ripoff of Helinox chairs,....but it’s very good at half the cost. When this was purchased I bought both this and the Helinox chair as the weight limit is higher on theirs. My wife is using this one and the other is for me. Both appear all but identical. Last: I’m promised compensation for this review, but that didn’t change what I would have said.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Simple as that. It's a third of the price of the Helinox Zero chairs I've seen online... but it seems to work great so far. I am a pretty small dude, so the size is not an issue, but it seems pretty sturdy for such a small and compact chair. Last camping trip we got attacked by wasps, so we actually set up two of these chairs in the minivan and ate in there. It worked out quite well. I really like these chairs for the price. Like I said, I'm not a huge dude, so I can't tell you how they would accomodate a 6'2" 200lb person... but they are great for us!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Koichi Mizushima

customer_reviews.title: My friends envy my chairs
customer_reviews.text: Any of my friends who have these types of chairs - from the highest end to the Walmart specials - they envy mine, and I like mine best too! They have extra features like a way to hang the carry bag off the chair and use it for sensible storage, platforms for sandy or rocky terrain (store in bag), mesh for lighter weight and coolness, velcro straps to keep it more together when bagging it, and a nice shoulder strap for carrying. Yeah you don't want to fall down into these chairs, but they've held 215lb friends with no problem, and squirrely little me. Great camp, tailgate and concert chair.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Defective. Fabric is too small for the frame.
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is too small for the frame and will not fit with any amount of pulling or strength. And I know I'm doing it correctly because I already have the same chair. I bought an identical chair (also a Moon Lence) a few years ago that is the same chair, same manufacturer, same design that fits together perfectly. However, in the new design they added pockets and in doing so, they fabric is about a centimeter shorter on each edge compared to my old chair. There is no way it will fit on the frame. Terrible quality control!
customer_reviews.author: Mom785943

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE! DON’T WASTE MONEY ON A MORE EXPENSIVE BRAND
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waist a bunch of money on a more expensive brand. I have owned this chair for over two years. It is extremely easy to set up and take down and packs into a small package. The main reason for my 5 star review is I have put hundreds of sitting hours in this chair and it has held up flawlessly. This chair is perfect and comfy. I have zero complaints or downsides. The only issue may be discomfort for elderly people or super tall people. I am 5’10” and don’t have any issues sitting in it but I think is someone was well into the 6’ then they may be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Szat

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Decent Structure
customer_reviews.text: Tested this chair out during a camping trip, and it held up really well. To give you an idea of what to expect: it is a lightweight (aluminum) collapsable chair. Unfortunately that means that it does feel a bit like it flexes and contracts when you sit on it and get up. That's completely normal, considering its intended purpose. If you're expecting the same sturdiness as a regular camping chair that you have to haul around on your shoulder, you'll be sorely disappointed. It's insanely lightweight, packs up super small, and is honestly as sturdy as any of the more expensive brands. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chair for Camping & Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these chairs for camping because we needed something compact due to all of our camping gears. First of all, they are really comfortable and lightweight, not to mention how compact they are. So, we love them right off the bat. Unfortunately, one of the chairs had stitching coming off after just one use in our backyard. I contacted the seller, Moon Lence, and they responded immediately. After sending proof of the defective areas, they sent us a replacement chair immediately. Just in time for our upcoming camping trip. You can't beat great customer service like Moon Lence! I already recommended this product to our friends.
customer_reviews.author: Noogie

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for budget conscious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my girlfriend was jealous of my chair (other brand) when we go backpacking. This chair is actually more comfortable than my much more expensive chair, but it is a pound heavier. That may not sound like much, but when you backpack as much as I do, it adds up. The chair was very tight when first assembled but not too difficult to put together. The chair when packed in the case is fairly compact, but not as compact as the more expensive chairs. For the price, this little chair is a winner and suitable for someone starting out backpacking or camping.
customer_reviews.author: fly4awhiteguy74

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, small, mad for kids
customer_reviews.text: Sending these back. They are so fragile and small, weak plastic parts and thin aluminum. Sitting in the chair literally makes the chair wobble and I weigh 168lbs. If you lean in any direction you WILL fall over. Absolutely NOT RECOMMENDED. Should be priced 50% less and marked for children, not adults.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Office Solution

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backpacking chair
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are perfect for backpacking or car camping. They're very comfortable, lightweight, sturdy, reasonably priced, and easy to pack up in the included bag. The chairs are comfortable for me (6' 200lb) and my girlfriend (5'8" 120lb). She even sat on my lap in one of the chairs and it held both of us leaning on the back two legs. They're super comfortable and a good height for a backpacking chair. They even have a pocket for holding items including a drink.
customer_reviews.author: Hooles

customer_reviews.title: Makes taking along a chair a viable option.  Love.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the chair. I'm 5'2" and the back comes to the base of my neck so there is no neck support, however, I'm using this for an easy take along chair for festivals, beach, concerts, etc... and not using it for casual camping where I would be more comfortable in a heavier, larger chair with armrests. I carried it around in a small tote with bottles of water, sunscreen, etc. and never regretted carrying it. It takes less than a minute to set up or take down and fits back into the carry bag easily. I keep my chairs (I bought 4) in my car. So light! Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack up, you’ll take it everywhere!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this chair!! Just took it on its first backpacking trip, and it was even better then I hoped! I put it next to my friends REI chair in the picture for reference, which I noticed a few differences and prefer mine honestly. The A-frame stance on this chair is on the sides which allows for more support, when the REI chair has the A-frame going front to back to it’s easier to tip sideways if you lean too far. Also, CUP HOLDERS!! Fantastic product, I bought one for my best friend and my boyfriend already:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 6'5" 240 I usually buy cheap camping chairs from Vons or Harbor Freight. They make my back sore and then they tear or break after about three uses. These have been a good investment, they have held up well. They are smaller than they look in the pictures but are comfy, even for me. Spending a little more on quality has paid off with this product. I will stop buying junk camp chairs from Vons.
customer_reviews.author: Sweaty Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Lightweight and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pack of two on Prime Day. As an avid backpacker and camper, I was skeptical that these chairs would be as good as I thought they would be. I opened them up, they are surprisingly very easy to put together and quite durable. I mostly bought these for portability and weight and they check all those boxes. One con is that the feet on the legs need to be a little bigger so just be mindful that it isn't a rocking chair. In the mud, you may need to adjust it a bit to keep it from not sinking. It works perfect on flat surfaces. I am happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K. to the L.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ozark trail at WM carries a significantly better Helinox knockoff. The angle on these is just a little bit off. But it makes a huge difference. I find these incredibly uncomfortable. Additionally, there’s nothing preventing the horizontal bar from spinning in the two end hubs which makes assembly much harder, and it would seem sturdiness would suffer. On the plus side, the little side pocket/pouches are nice. The included carrying bag is also very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Zipperer

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a 242 pound fella that happens to not be any taller than 4 foot, then do I have the chair for you! These light weight portable beauties are so low to the ground you could probably sit criss cross applesauce. What grown adult doesn’t want to sit criss cross applesauce??!! BBQ? Pop these little half hammocks out of your light weight carrying bag and BAM. Knees to chest. Buyer beware. If you sit down too fast, your own knee will punch you right in your OWN EYE!
customer_reviews.author: Nina S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable packable chair
customer_reviews.text: We go to a music festival every year. We have tried so many different kinds of chairs to take with us. Some are too heavy or just awkward to carry but very comfortable once set up. Some were ridiculous inflatables that are embarrassing to try to get going. Finally, a chair. It's very portable. I throw mine into my backpack and go. You will be amazed by how comfortable these are (unless you are very tall or otherwise very large). I appreciate the brilliant design that fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gaballa

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this chair
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be a decent purchase, but it didn't last very long. I weigh around 150lbs and after a couple weeks of using this chair it began to stretch to the point where I could feel the cross bar. And now, after just about two months of use, it broke. I would not recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Gross

customer_reviews.title: Buddies were jealous
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC addition to my backpack. It is not as light weight as one of the chairs you can purchase at REI, but it is worth carrying the extra pound. Comfort while backpacking is extremely important to me. I cannot sit on rocks and logs all day and feel comfortable. It causes me to be unable to hang out around the camp fire for long periods of time. This chair fixed all of that for me. Easy to assemble, easy to move, and easy to relax in. I only wish it were 1 pound lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: I weigh 275lbs
customer_reviews.text: I have used this chair for over a year now, and it is still going strong. Like the headline says, I fluctuate from about 279-260lbs and am 6'1. This chair has held up great. The last time I went camping I was letting my buddy borrow it, and his wife was even siting on his knee in this chair (which I promptly told them to not do once I saw it cause I thought it may break!) But it has been great, it isn't heavy, and I keep it in my car all the time when I'm not camping just in case. Never know when you may need a chair!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew I.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a $30 chair
customer_reviews.text: This little chair seems just like the more expensive versions. I do not own the Helinox, but from memories of sitting in one, this little guy is very comparable for half the price. It may be a tad heavier but im not that crazy about weight whenI back pack if it means I can be just a little bit more comfortable. This chair is also really good for tailgaiting. You can toss it in the trunk with all the booze and food and it takes up about a quarter of the space of a regular folding chair.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking chair!
customer_reviews.text: We've had these chairs for a couple years and mainly use them for backpacking. We use the outside straps to strap them to the outside our packs. They're very light and worth the extra weight so you can relax after a long day. They're very comfortable and let you lean back. Easy enough to set up and take down. You do need to be careful that sparks from your campfire don't hit it or you will get melted holes. Randomly the zipper on my chair's case broke this year but my husband's is still just fine. I discovered I even prefer them to the larger camp chairs, they're that comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: splatter

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have the Helinox chair as well as this chair. While the Helinox is better made (sturdier poles and material), this does well for the price. If you have the $100 to spend on a chair, the Helinox is your choice. If you want to good chair for under $30, this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shmay

customer_reviews.title: I am so impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are terrific!! I am 5'6 and weigh around 140lbs. I sat in this chair at a concert 6 hours off and on. I would never say that I once was uncomfortable. While everyone else was luging in their heavy chairs I ran by carrying 3 of these like they didn't weigh anything. My kids and I throw them on our back and take off on our MTN bikes with no problem. I would highly recommend everyone who is outdoorsy to invest in these chairs.
customer_reviews.author: LaShawnda

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price or comfort!
customer_reviews.text: They are a little heavier than one might like for backpacking, but for the price, they were exactly what we needed for kayak camping, where weight is less of an issue. They are sturdy and easy to assemble, and kept our butts off the wet ground. There is a backward tilt to them that is great for relaxing, but if you want to sit up a little straighter, just slide something under the back feet to elevate them.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great, portable camping chairs
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I purchased these chairs prior to a series of camping trips, and they've worked really well. Set-up and tear-down is simple, the drink holders/pockets are serviceable, and they're pretty comfy. We've even taken to having one in the living room as a gaming chair. They're so light they initially feel like they might break, but we haven't had any issues (I was 175lbs when we purchased the chairs).
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bell

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light and easy for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is perfect for anything outdoorsy: backyard BBQ, tailgating, camping, backpacking. When packed up it is super light, and the case has loop holes that can strap when out backpacking. Not to mention these chairs are very comfy, they just hug your body when sitting, and are not too low...just right. They are very sturdy as well...only thing they are missing are cup holders but since you are low enough to the ground, your drink is only a slight reach away. Highly recommended for the avid outdoorsman! Cheaper than their competitor the Helinox and just as light.
customer_reviews.author: lizzi

customer_reviews.title: Nice for bike camping
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for bicycle camping trips. It is lite enough to make it worth packing a chair. Setup takes some getting used to. The poles flex a bit, but it takes some force to make it happen. Without the force, you are not getting the chair together. My only complaint is that the feet sink into the ground pretty easily. Some larger pads on the feet would help, but it isn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: A. Que

customer_reviews.title: Great price for some lightweight camping chairs
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves camping and we have been slowly replacing some of our gear for more compact and lighter options. My husband bought a similar chair from REI for about $100. We ended up buying this set of 2 for way less and after receiving and testing it out...we returned the REI chair! I'm so happy to have saved so much money with these chairs. The chair is easy to assemble, compact, and super lightweight! Can't wait to take it on our next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: girlrobot

customer_reviews.title: great for camping
customer_reviews.text: I brought this chair with me camping, and it was amazing. I usually bring my regular sports folding chair, but its pretty big and bulky, so it's super annoying when trying to travel light. It folds really small and neatly into its travel bag, and is super easy to set up, without crazy instructions. The seat is low down to the floor, so its kinda annoying to get up, but so worth the trade off of so much less bulk. This chair is a must have if you like to sit on a chair while camping, but hate the bulk of regular folding outdoor chairs.
customer_reviews.author: sammy1

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Four of five stars given because it's a good value, but could be sturdier. Especially when used in sand or deep gravel, you need to be deliberate about how you apply your weight so that the chair doesn't lean or favor certain legs. Easy to assemble and disassemble, and packs down small. Significantly cheaper than competitors. Has held up well so far through a busy season of camping and adventuring.
customer_reviews.author: J. VDE

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these chairs and are completely satisfied. Just as advertised - the chairs are lightweight and sturdy. We use these when we watch our children youth sports activities and have brought these chairs on the airplane to tournaments. The chairs are so lightweight and take up so little room, you can pretty much take it anywhere or like us, just leave a few in the car. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Allender

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & portable
customer_reviews.text: The chair bag is smaller than I thought which is an amazing thing. We bought it for camping and the beach. My husband used it on the beach and said no sinking. Our dog rests comfortably on it in his blanket as well. I love how easy and quick it was to put together. The only suggestion/improvement is to put a string on all 4 corners instead of 2, so all can be pulled easier. Other than that, I'm excited to use it for our next camping trip coming up!
customer_reviews.author: Olive Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Love my little chair!
customer_reviews.text: A friend introduced me to this type of folding chair. I didn't want to pay the full price at a certain brand name outdoor store, so decided to try this one after reading reviews. I love it! I've used this a lot this summer, I can put it in my backpack and then have a super comfortable chair to sit in after a hike. It's light-weight, easy to put together, and very compact.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon and MelisaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, lightweight and well made!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite pieces of gear! This chair is serious comfortable, lightweight and easy to set-up. I can’t wait to see how it holds up to heavy use across time! Although it is cheaper than similar models out there, the stitching appears to be tight and the chair is well-made. I am glad I went with this chair instead of dumping $100 into a chair that is very similar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: shipped with a bent leg. Update
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have opened the chair before my return period ended. It looks like a fine chair, but one of my legs was shipped slightly bent. Hopefully, this won't be a failure point. I will post a follow up after use. Update! They sent me a new chair free of charge. The original one is working great as well. Even with a slight bend it holds my weight easy. The new chair is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Ok product. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the leg elastic rope is loose therefore you have to watch out for the leg piece to be fully inserted before putting it under tension with the seat fabric (almost lost an eye doing that). The little black plastic piece on the bottom leg is loose, i almost lost mine as it got buried in the soil where it was set up, the manufacturer should have riveted the piece on the leg.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fan
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend for people over 200lbs, especially if you plan on using it on soft surfaces like sand/dirt/grass. The legs of the chair instantly sunk into the ground. I weight just over 200 and it wasn't super comfortable. Also, 2 of the pegs on the legs fell off the first time I used it. I returned it shortly after buying it and I got my money back quick, so that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Engle

customer_reviews.title: Read if you’ve never owned a lightweight camping chair
customer_reviews.text: So here the short and sweet of it, the chair is beyond light, very easy to assemble, and seems sturdy enough for me at 175lbs. BUT, it is honestly NOT very comfortable. It takes some getting used to and some finagling to get it to become tolerable for hours at a time. It’s no rocking chair, but then again aren’t we all just buying this because of its small packable form factor? I would definitely buy another one so I’d have a set for spur of the moment camping company, but if I had a trip planned I’d stick to traditional sized folding chairs.
customer_reviews.author: NoBsReviews

customer_reviews.title: Super portable
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used these at the beach in San Diego, people next to us came over and asked where we got these cool collapsible chairs at! They were amazed at how e-z it was to set up, how small and portable they were! FYI...If you've got some booty to shake they might not work for you...and don't try to lean back bcuz they are not built like a barcalounger ;)
customer_reviews.author: 916Funkster

customer_reviews.title: Buy it already
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE THIS CHAIR. We talked about getting these for 2 years and finally made the plunge. Why did we not do it sooner? After taking out of the bag it takes me about 60 seconds to entirely set the chair up and then boom. Comfy chairs you can take anywhere with all of the convenience. Bonus: they even have pockets! I haven’t sat on rocks or sand with them yet, and I am curious about the sturdiness of their little feet. Only time will tell, though. Adventure awaits!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra weight in the pack for comfort in camp.
customer_reviews.text: I compared this to a friends more expensive chair sold in a well known outdoors chain (name is three letters) and the frame was nearly identical, if not exactly the same. The only difference real we noticed was that the nylon part of the chair was heavier than the more expensive chair. I won't lie, it's a little heavy for backpacking but at my age it's worth it for the comfort in camp.
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan Dad

customer_reviews.title: It's a light camping chair with big feet.
customer_reviews.text: I may have short-changed the chair on stars, as I don't expect a chair weighing less than 2 lbs. to provide 5 star comfort, sturdiness and support. We flew 1500 miles in a small plane to attend an airshow, and weight was an issue so we bought the Moon Lence 2 pack. The wide feet were a Godsend in the rainy, soggy grass, and they are light enough to haul around in the stuff sack to any event where you might want to sit. No sturdiness issues at my 225lbs. It felt that it could take considerably more.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M. Wishon

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a solution to my festival seating problem for years. I needed something I could carry all day then be able to sit on during the evening. The size of these is perfect (I could easily fit two in my backpack and still had room for plenty of other stuff) and the set up is easy! The chairs offer good support and did not feel at any time like they were going to bend or break. We sat in them for about 3 hours and they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri L.

customer_reviews.title: A decent value
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are significantly heavier and bulkier than the Helinox their mimicking. I don’t that I’ll throw it on my backpack, but it’ll go in the car and the canoe for sure. The chairs are a damn sight better than sitting in those taco Style chairs or on a picnic table bench. Have had them a few months. Holding up well, even around a four year old camper.
customer_reviews.author: keith harrington

customer_reviews.title: One broke, otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 chairs. Setup speed and comfort are great, but one ripped from a 190lb person sitting down after being used only twice. Update; emailed the customer service and they have stated they will send a replacement. I'll update again if/when they do.
customer_reviews.author: jro

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely perfect chairs! They are very compact, they fit in my backpack with food, blankets, drinks and dog toys! They are so easy to set up and fold and are really light weight. They are great to take on picnics and to store in my small apartment! They are also really comfortable, we've even used them when we needed extra seating in the apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for smaller people
customer_reviews.text: Pros: super light weight, easy to set up and pack up. Fits in my tennis bag so I don’t have to share benches with other players during COVID. Cons: I’m probably too large for this chair so take this review with that in mind. It’s low so getting in and out can feel unstable but I haven’t fallen yet. Can’t really move around too much because it feels unstable.
customer_reviews.author: David Joo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I purchased this as a deal of the day and a backup for the more expensive portable chair that stays in my trunk. It packs down small and the frame is easy to put together. It is hard to get the chair part put on properly. The fabric is really tight. The back is also shorter than my other chair. It is just not comfortable. I have a friend with a young son who may enjoy it once he learns to set it up, so I can pass it on. Otherwose it would be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got to admit I was a little hesitant on buying this but I’m really happy with my purchase! It really holds up to other expensive name brands. It’s light weight, sturdy, and easy to assemble. Took it on a camping trip and our friends (who paid $100 plus for theirs) really liked ours. It had more features (like a little pocket) and looked and felt just like their expensive ones. Would buy again and recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Daniella

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Somewhat sturdy as if you are on soft ground or sand it will sink into the ground. There is a ground pad that can be purchased to resolve this issue. It was smaller than I expected. I’m 63”/150 lbs and I fit fix and the grandkids love it. However my spouse 69”/175 lbs was not comfortable in it. We will keep it as I love how compact it is for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: K.Willy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: As someone who also owned the chair that this one is copying it's a great deal for the price which is 1/3 of the Helinox chair one. It's as well built and durable as the original. It's definitely not comfortable to sit in for long periods of time but if I'm taking it camping I won't be sitting in it for long periods of times so that's not a big concern. The only con that I see is that it weighs twice as much as the original (2lbs vs 1lb). I bought it for car camping so not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: H_P

customer_reviews.title: Solid strong, lightweight camp chair. I keep it in my car when I am not backpacking and it is so nice to have!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome solid camping chair, and cant beat it for the price, I know most of these chairs are in the $100 + range and this one was around $30 when I ordered it. Be aware the bag is difficult to compare the size to but if you are looking to take this backpacking it will take up a bit of space in your pack but you can minimize space by just bringing the poles and seat separately. ***Note: The pole construction is all one piece that is broken down similar to a tent pole and compacts nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T.

customer_reviews.title: It is good for children but there is no way I would ...
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design, but not for an adult. This folding chair is small. It is good for children but there is no way I would risk having someone I know sit in this. Although its not really complicated to put together, there are still no instructions of even a picture of the chair to use as a reference. If this chair lasts more than 6 months I will be surprised. Would not recommend to average size adult or even a small adult .... Kids chair
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Fastest return of all time
customer_reviews.text: I sat in them long enough to request my Amazon return label. I’m 6ft, 175 pounds and I could not fit in this “chair”. I kept feeling like I was going to fall out of it and that there was no way it would support me. Uncomfortable doesn’t begin to describe. I’d say you get what you pay for, but there are regular camping chairs that go for $25 each and I can’t figure out why these are priced as such. Would not recommend for anyone over the age of 12
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Croft

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are light weight and comfy around the campfire. I believe this model is slightly sturdier than the earlier version (according to a friend who commented on ours). They are a bit tricky to put together, but they are well built, reinforced at the connection points, and easy to transport. Kids and adults like these chairs in our family.
customer_reviews.author: cre8inghome

customer_reviews.title: The mesh fabric will not last.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with a hole in the mesh fabric. I would not buy again -I think the mesh fabric will not last long. I didn’t return it because I needed it for a trip. I put gorilla tape on the hole -I hope it will lasts. I will have to find something to patch it with. The seller contacted me and said they will replace. I will update.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Overall good chair, at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good chair, and the addition of the pocket/drink-holder is a nice feature on this new version. We have three of these now, and the only real complaint is the size of the foot cushions. If these were larger, the chair would perform better on soft ground. I find that the chair tends to 'dig in' on soft ground and feels less balanced. Overall happy with these chairs.
customer_reviews.author: cjonesgo

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a seat
customer_reviews.text: I bought three, all different colors, for my entire family. We actually take them backpacking. It’s nice to have a comfortable seat after a long day of walking with 30 pounds on your back. The chairs are pretty lite so I wouldn’t poop myself into them and they will fall over if you squirm too much. If you cooly settle into it, you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Zyrlu

customer_reviews.title: Great little backpacking chair.  Needs a headrest.
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpacking and it is definitely worth it's weight. Very sturdy and easy to assemble, disassemble, and pack. Very comfortable, but after purchasing, I came across a chair with a similar price point that has a higher back and headrest (that one does weigh an extra pound or so more than this one tho). I love the color choices and have purchased this little gem for friends. It sure is nice to have a comfortable chair after hours on the trail!
customer_reviews.author: amanda zito

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy. I’m a husky 6’0” 240lbs. Fits me great and sturdy. I added mini tennis balls to the feet for the sand so it doesn’t sink in as much. Case is big enough to pack it all in with the tennis balls on the feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and functional
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than REI chairs and does the same thing (all most likely from the same PRC factories). Have hauled on 5 day back country mountain tours and many local picknicks etc. and works like a charm. Corners that go over the poles are rugged. If you're gonna buy from overseas, buy it cheap so the saying goes. That said, I would pay 2x for one of these made in the USA, which currently doesn't exist.
customer_reviews.author: brian williams

customer_reviews.title: No upper back support
customer_reviews.text: Not for use for any length of time (more than 30 mins) if you want back support. I am 5'0" and was not comfortable in it. If you want it because it is light and use it for short periods of time, it would be fine. I like to lounge fireside and sit and read and draw for longer lengths of time when we camp and this was not the chair for me. The lack of upper back support and not being able to lean back with full support got uncomforable quickly and I started to angle my body to tuck into the corners for more support.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L Harcher

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars really
customer_reviews.text: Son and I each got one for a long AT hike. You want to be able to relax comfortably and stretch a bit and stay off damp ground. It is a little cumbersome in getting back in the storage bag but very happy with it. It is kind of bulky for the hard core nothing hanging on the outside of the pack hikers. But I strapped it on my pack vertically and no problem. Really nice to knock out the hike and have a comfortable seat to eat and relax.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: Great well made convenient chair with a good price
customer_reviews.text: Super light sturdy little chairs. At first they feel kinda unstable but they had no problem for adults within the weight limit listed. Only sort of con is they are quite short chairs. They fold up so nicely in there bag that kinda looks like a shoe bag. Best of all they are pretty comfortable. Materials seem good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good design - poor execution
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely comfortable and portable chair that should last about 4 months of regular use. There are 2 points of failure: 1) Seat may sag until your rear touches the crossbar on the chair while sitting upright - I'm160 lb by the way, 2) Corner pocket that holds the end of each pole may tear open, easily fixed with cloth tape though. Both of these problems could be fixed by using more durable fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight camping chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair due to it's size and weight as I was taking it on some extended backpacking treks. The chair is comfortable to sit in, easy to set up and take down. It's very light weight and comes with a nice carrying case. The only drawback would be the tiny little legs. If it's wet they will dig in pretty quickly and be very careful about leaning to one side or another excessively. I've almost fallen out of the chair when leaning to get something, but you need to sacrifice some aspects to have it so small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of these now. For the price, I was worried they would be inferior to the REI version, or other big name brands. I was wrong, they're great! They are sturdy and fold up nice and small making it easy to travel with. We take them on trips across the country to watch our daughter play field hockey, camping trips or just anywhere you would normally bring a chair. So much easier to bring something small and light that sets up and tears down easily without having to lug a big chair on your back and smack it into people.
customer_reviews.author: Gaviotas12

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review: Lightweight, but broke within a month. ***Great Customer Service***
customer_reviews.text: The chair is lightweight and comfortable. However, after only a month of use, the top left attachment point has ripped through and it looks like the top right is close behind. ***Updated Review*** The seller quickly reached out to me and offered to replace the broken chair. Chair arrived quickly which is amazing because I am currently overseas. Very impressed with the customer service. I am hopeful that the first chair was just a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: 47Joe

customer_reviews.title: Small for typical size adults
customer_reviews.text: We returned these, unfortunately, as they were very small and cramped feeling for average size adults (I am 5'8"). Even my middle school kids did not find them very comfortable. They're short and so don't offer upper back or neck support. They are light weight and portable, which is a plus for camping and hiking and other activities, but I didn't want to sit in them for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great little chair
customer_reviews.text: So I saw a chair like this at my local Scheels but it was 100$ and as much as I liked the idea of a backpacking chair I was not willing to drop a "C" not on it. Then. I found this chair on Amazon and decided that 35$ was worth the risk. This chair is the exact same one I tried and Scheels but is way cheaper. If your looking for a chair that takes up little space and it light then pick this up.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin N.

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: This was much larger than I was expecting, and heavy to boot. For some reason, the chair comes packaged in a heavy canvas bag which is not ideal for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Two-Line Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I’m having a hard time understanding why people are giving these chairs 5 stars. They are flimsy and when you set them up, they are easy up until you put the last loop on the poles. It is lightweight and compact but it does not give good support. After setting up the chairs a few times, it was such a pain that we just opted to sit on a blanket instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: Wobbles quite a bit - each set of legs operates independently of the other, so if you're not on perfectly level ground it's not going to be comfortable as you're at an angle. It also doesn't lean back quite enough, so again, if you're not on perfectly level ground you either feel like you're going to fall backwards or as though you're not even sitting. It's light and easy to set up; certainly better than a rock or the ground, but there are better options around. I'm 5'9" 160, avid hiker/camper
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a 5 day backpacking/portaging trip to Algonquin. I truly was impressed with the lightweight design, comfort and durability. The price made it even better. It was small enough to attach to the back of my pack. The bag that is comes in is made of a good quality fabric and has loops on the side so you can attach it easily to your pack. It can be a little difficult to attach the seat to the frame but after you have done it a couple of times it's no big deal. I found that it was easiest attaching the lower portion of the seat to the frame first and then the top portion last.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good chair.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Helinox chairs and need a 3rd in a pinch for a trip to the boundary waters. I found this for $30 and it’s been fine. It’s made the same, is the same weight and as far as I can tell the only difference is the max-weight capacity. I recommend this for anyone who doesn’t want to spend $100 on a fairly similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as said. Quite pleased with these chairs. I weight 195lbs and was doubting these chairs would hold. They did ! Surprisingly comfortable. The legs where a little shorter than I imagined but not a problem. Really like that they fold up into such a small space. Will not take up any room on my boat compared to the old ones. Happy I made the purchase.🙂👍
customer_reviews.author: Doug C

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a pain
customer_reviews.text: I would say this chair is all right. It’s a pain in the butt to put together, it is lightweight, and it supports us. The fabric is really tight and hard to pull over the legs of the chair and doing it every time you take the chair apart and put it back together is annoying. Overall though it is lightweight. Which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Weight, stability, and comfort at a fraction of the big brand price
customer_reviews.text: Please compare this to the “name brands”! At 1/2-1/3 the price you get better stability, better comfort, and (since they’re all made in China anyway) similar durability. Seriously, order it and sit in it. Then go to my favorite outdoor store (who’s name rhymes with R E I) and sit in theirs and the other big brands they carry. Compare the weight, comfort, and stability. If you pick the big brands, congratulations you got an awesome chair. If you pick this one, congratulations: you got an awesome chair at a fraction of the price!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Kilwine

customer_reviews.title: Portable and scary
customer_reviews.text: Chair is super portable and fits in my bookbag when I travel by plane. It was kind of a pain to put together and I did fall out of it once but other than that, it's not too bad. Update: still love the chairs but the legs are starting to bend. We don't use them too often but when we do use them we are hesitant because it seems like they may break.
customer_reviews.author: BornLove

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly comfortable chairs for such a compact and light weight package.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are amazingly light and comfortable. I purchased a comparable chair at a major retailer two days before ordering these and that chair was almost twice as heavy as the Moon Lence chairs. Those other chairs are going back to retail store. The Moon Lence chairs are definitely worth the price. I am going on a trip and will use them to watch a parade. Got very positive first impression when using them at home after receiving them from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: super easy to carry, but not big enough for large adult
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to carry, fold up easily, and the supplied case is great. My wife and 7 year old love sitting in them. But that are simply too small for me (6'2", 200 lbs). If you are a smaller person, you'll love this, but if you are bigger, you might want to look for something bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my son who used it in his boy scout activities for a couple of times. The chair is very compact, and it sits comfortably. We both like it. After he returned from his most recent camp, I noticed one leg was slightly bent at joint and the seat was no longer in tension. I contacted Moon Lence asking if the leg could be repaired or replaced. To my surprise, Moon Lence offered to replace the entire chair. They even send me emails, reminding me to send them my shipping address. The chair arrived in no time. Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: RoboDad

product_meta.title: MOON LENCE Outdoor Ultralight Portable Folding Chairs with Carry Bag Heavy Duty 242lbs Capacity Camping Folding Chairs Beach Chairs
feature_bullets: HIGH DURABILITY: Seat made of 600D Oxford cloth with high-strength aluminum alloy frame. Our heavy duty camping chair weighs only 2 pounds which can hold up to 242 pounds/110kg.
SUPER COMFORT: Unique and ergonomic seat design gives you the best seat experience allowing you to relax. Breathable and soft seat net makes you feel comfortable while you sit.
PORTABLE DESIGN: Both the mesh and the holders can be folded into small pieces.This portable chair is compact enough to put into your backpack or your carry-on luggage.
EASY SETUP and CLEAN: Foldable mesh and metal poles make it easy to set up and fold down. It is super easy to clean: just sweep off or clean by soap water.
VERSATILITY: The ideal choice for Backpackers, Tailgaters, Hikers, Concertgoers, Campers, Adventurers, and anyone looking for comfort without the bulk. A decent HOLIDAY GIFT for friends and families.
